info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 3 at 9:36AM CDT by NWS Nashville TN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee...
Stones River Near Donelson affecting Davidson County.
For the Stones River...including Donelson...elevated river levels are forecast.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Stones River near Donelson.
* WHEN...From this morning until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Portions of the Stones River Greenway between Percy Priest Dam and Lebanon Road are inundated. At 23.0 feet, Sections of the Stones River Greenway are impassable between Percy Priest Dam and Lebanon Road, and low lying areas along the river are inundated near the park on Jackson Downs Blvd.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 20.4 feet and rising. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 345 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
